results.title: The Corn is in danger = Kornet er fare
results.creator_credit: Hagen Hasselbalch and Nordisk Films Kompagni
results.brief_description: Opens with scenes of the harvesting of wheat. The life cycle of the corn weevil is shown and the damage that the weevil causes to stored wheat. An agricultural expert is shown examining an infested barn where the weevils are under flooboards and in all possible cracks and crevices; the building is sprayed to kill them. Ends with an appeal to all Danes to help destroy the pest. In Danish.

results.title: The Corinella Jetty
results.brief_description: In 2005, the small waterline community of Corinella in south eastern Victoria, was at risk of losing its iconic jetty. Barbara Oates, a local and owner of the general store, rallied the community to raise $10,000 to have the jetty renovated and extended, ensuring the prominent landmark would be enjoyed for generations to come.

results.title: The Cordellera Expedition
results.brief_description: Follows an expedition retracing the steps of Canada’s early explorers including the use of stills and archival footage. Spectacular scenery and wildlife images make this film a must for those who love the outdoors.

results.title: The Copter kids
results.creator_credit: Ronald Spencer, Pacesetter Productions and Children's Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A children’s comedy with a social message. A group of town kids form a vigilante group to stop an irresponsible cattle rustler and his two dim-witted sons from poaching cattle from Bramble Hollow to be sold to the European Communities.

results.title: The Cop and the anthem
results.creator_credit: Peter Mark Schifter, Terry Benes and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Soapy (played by Robert Morse), an affable vagrant in New York City at the turn of the century tries many ways to get himself put into jail for the winter. A classic tale of irony and pathos. Based on the short story by O. Henry.

results.title: The Cooling system and fuel system
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Automobile Maintenance”.
Demonstrates how to check for leaks in the cooling system; check the fan and water pump; mechanical operation of the carburettor; filters and vents; and fuel pumps.

results.title: The Coolbaroo club (A)
results.creator_credit: Roger Scholes, Penny Robins, Australian Film Commission, Coolbaroo Club Productions and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: A study of what life was like for many Aboriginal Australians in post World War 11 Western Australia. For 14 years, between 1946 and 1960, the Coolbaroo Club in Perth, Western Australia, was a meeting place and a community focus for the local Aboriginal community. The Coolbaroo Club was unique in that it was the only Aboriginal-run dance club in a city that was notorious for its unofficial apartheid, police harassment, identity cards for Aboriginals, curfews and bureaucratic obstruction. The club attracted interest from Black musicians both in Australia and overseas. Nat ‘King’ Cole, Harold Blair and the Harlem Globetrotters being among the international celebrities. As well as providing a place where the Aboriginal community could safely gather, the club was also known for its political activities. It issued a newspaper and later became an effective political organisation, speaking out on issues of the day which were affecting Aboriginal people. The exceptional achievement of the Coolbaroo League in finding an affirmative response to white oppression can be seen today as an important step forward in the development of Aboriginal self determination. The film is a powerful record of this achievement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Scholes, Penny Robins, Australian Film Commission, Coolbaroo Club Productions and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.description: A study of what life was like for many Aboriginal Australians in post World War 11 Western Australia. For 14 years, between 1946 and 1960, the Coolbaroo Club in Perth, Western Australia, was a meeting place and a community focus for the local Aboriginal community. The Coolbaroo Club was unique in that it was the only Aboriginal-run dance club in a city that was notorious for its unofficial apartheid, police harassment, identity cards for Aboriginals, curfews and bureaucratic obstruction. The club attracted interest from Black musicians both in Australia and overseas. Nat ‘King’ Cole, Harold Blair and the Harlem Globetrotters being among the international celebrities. As well as providing a place where the Aboriginal community could safely gather, the club was also known for its political activities. It issued a newspaper and later became an effective political organisation, speaking out on issues of the day which were affecting Aboriginal people. The exceptional achievement of the Coolbaroo League in finding an affirmative response to white oppression can be seen today as an important step forward in the development of Aboriginal self determination. The film is a powerful record of this achievement.
description_for_label: A study of what life was like for many Aboriginal Australians in post World War 11 Western Australia. For 14 years, between 1946 and 1960, the Coolbaroo Club in Perth, Western Australia, was a meeting place and a community focus for the local Aboriginal community. The Coolbaroo Club was unique in that it was the only Aboriginal-run dance club in a city that was notorious for its unofficial apartheid, police harassment, identity cards for Aboriginals, curfews and bureaucratic obstruction. The club attracted interest from Black musicians both in Australia and overseas. Nat ‘King’ Cole, Harold Blair and the Harlem Globetrotters being among the international celebrities. As well as providing a place where the Aboriginal community could safely gather, the club was also known for its political activities. It issued a newspaper and later became an effective political organisation, speaking out on issues of the day which were affecting Aboriginal people. The exceptional achievement of the Coolbaroo League in finding an affirmative response to white oppression can be seen today as an important step forward in the development of Aboriginal self determination. The film is a powerful record of this achievement.

results.title: The Coolangatta Gold
results.creator_credit: Igor Auzins, John Weiley, Hoyts and Michael Edgley International
results.brief_description: A young son is filled with burning resentment at being forced to live in his brother’s shadow. His brother is burdened by their father’s desire for glory. Their father is obsessed by the need to redeem his own failure twenty years before. A dramatic story of family conflict which culminates in the spectacular excitement of the greatest beach and surf triaquathon in the world, the Coolangatta Gold. Both brothers enter the race, one to win for his father, one bent to beat his father. To do so, they must also compete against each other. Cast: Joss McWilliam, Nick Tate, Robyn Nevin, Josephine Smulders, Colin Friels.

results.title: The Cook, the Thief, His Wife & Her Lover
results.creator_credit: Elsevira, Erbograph Co., Vendex, Kees Kasander, Jean Paul Gaultier, Jan Roelfs, Peter Greenaway and Ben van Os
results.brief_description: The wife of an abusive criminal finds solace in the arms of a kind regular guest in her husband’s restaurant.

constellations_other.name: Into a World of Colour
constellations_other.description: Filmmakers have been using colour as a method of storytelling since the first moving pictures. Colour can be used to signify emotion, intensify drama or to create a strong visual aesthetic.

results.title: The Cook the thief his wife & her lover
results.creator_credit: Peter Greenaway, Kees Kasander, Films Incorporated, Erato FIlms and Allarts Cook
results.brief_description: The setting is a restaurant, La Hollondais, where the chef prepares a lavish menu every night. Among the regular customers are Albert Spica (Michael Gambon) a loud-mouthed, violent gangster who dines with his entourage of seedy men, and his bored, beautiful wife, Georgina (Helen Mirren). At another table each night sits Michael, a quiet man who’s always reading. He and Georgina soon begin a series of secret rendezvous, where they make passionate love. Eventually Albert discovers his wife’s infidelity and takes violent revenge, triggering a more unusual retaliation from her. This film is a parable about love, revenge and most of all greed, it is both funny and horrifying. Sacha Vierny’s cinematography and Greenaway’s use of colour are superb. Also stars Tim Roth, Richard Bohringer and Alan Howard.
